alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Walton; Holmes; Inland Bay; Inland Gulf; Jackson; North Walton; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 02 at 3:19AM EST until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama, including the following areas, Coffee, Dale, Geneva, Henry and Houston and Florida, including the following areas, Calhoun, Central Walton, Coastal Bay, Coastal Gulf, Gadsden, Holmes, Inland Bay, Inland Franklin, Inland Gulf, Jackson, Liberty, North Walton, South Walton and Washington. * WHEN...Through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A complex weather system is expected to lead to multiple rounds of heavy rainfall across the watch area through Sunday afternoon. In particular, portions of the Florida Panhandle and Big Bend are at most risk for flooding caused by excessive rainfall, with storm total amounts ranging from 3 to 6 inches. Meanwhile across portions of Southeast Alabama, storm total amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected. Localized higher amounts are also possible in the flood watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Walton; Holmes; Inland Bay; Inland Gulf; Jackson; North Walton; Washington
